website_summaries.verdict: Whether you're looking for the best smart sprinkler or you're looking for a bargain, you can find a better option than the Blossom Smart Watering Controller.
pros: Blossom's easy-to-use app helps you set a schedule for your sprinklers
Blossom watches the weather and adapts the schedule accordingly so you're not running your sprinklers in the rain
cons: Blossom gets the smart sprinkler basics right but lacks the detailed customization of its competitors
It's not weatherproof, it doesn't have onboard controls, and it doesn't work with many other smart-home gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Give it a month. It's horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Unless your wifi network and internet is flawless and never ever goes out, even for a second, so not get this!!!! Our wifi skips for a second and it shuts the whole rotation off. We couldn't figure out why our lawn was dying, and realized it was randomly shutting off. Also, tried going into manual mode and water the dying lawn station for an hour and it keeps shutting off at 30 min even though it shows it is still watering on my app. Horrible. Thanks for killing my lawn blossom.
customer_reviews.author: onlyoneash

customer_reviews.title: Simple Watering Job
customer_reviews.text: I've only got 2 zones to water, so this is more than I need. I've read other reviews about problems with wifi connection but mine seems fine. I even disconnected the power, and plugged back in. Synced back up without an issue. The only negative I have is the size of the plug-in cord. Instead of putting the transformer in the unit head, they put it into the plug, and that doesn't plug water-tight into my gang box. So, I've got to build a little cover over the unit and run an extension to the outside wall for the GFCI outlet. I've enjoyed using my phone to program and spot water between schedules.
customer_reviews.author: Pan Man

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in HAWAII!
customer_reviews.text: Looked everywhere on details and specs and nothing was said about not able to work in Hawaii. Ended up having to put in a mainland address to get it to work in manual mode only! 2 stars because easy to set up and manual mode works. Will probably return this because the smart watering does not work for my area. This really disappointed me because I was bragging to others about this. Guess I will tell all not to but
customer_reviews.author: Jonee111

customer_reviews.title: A MUST have for setting up and adjusting sprinklers.
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me when setting up my backyard sprinklers. Being able to turn them on and off from my phone was priceless. The only thing I wish this had what the ability to have differ start times. Basically, you can setting up a soaking schedule but it only starts at the same time as the routine for all the zones. So you can only start one routine time, where all your zones scheduled cycle through. In other words, if you want your backyard to start in the morning and then your front yard to start at night, that is not possible with the current app. I’m hoping for an update.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: What a deal...  It works!
customer_reviews.text: If you do your homework and read the directions, you'll have a good experience. It was easy for me to install and my sprinkler system was installed in 2001 when my house was built. The pairing process with the app was easy too. It worked great. Unlike many of my other Alexa items, it has lasted 2 months without needing to be re-installed. Not only that, I actually look forward to the push notifications and emails when this thing tells me it's not going to water today because of the forecast. What can I say, ti works!
customer_reviews.author: Bleach

customer_reviews.title: No granular controls, accept the logic or nothing
customer_reviews.text: Only allows single watering time daily. No ability to set am and pm schedules. Living in Texas is tough on lawns and plants. I had an Orbit B-Hyve and had an issue with my child turning the dial to disable the sprinklers so he would not have to mow. So I looked around and found the Blossom controller. No dial just smart controls. Orbit has a similar model for $30 more on Amazon. I figured I'll save $30. Bad move on my part. If you trust in SkyNet to ensure that your lawn will stay moist, go for it. In just a few days I am already seeing the lawn suffer. The plants as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Software and the system that drives this unit simply does not work.
customer_reviews.text: You never know when or if it watered the grass. Any rain within a hundred miles and it "SKIPS" a watering. We watched our grass die because storms were reported in the area but we never got a drop of rain. There is no way to override this feature. If you want to sit on your porch and use your phone it works great. I routinely received messages that "they" could not talk to the controller. So each time I texted them about what I should do but never received a reply. This appears to be one of those situations where the customers debug the software on the customers dime.
customer_reviews.author: CarlS0525

customer_reviews.title: will not connent
customer_reviews.text: The APP is the worst I have ever used and the product will not connect to my wi-fi not matter what I do. I have reset to factory mode twice. When I try to log in to my account it fails. I have deleted the app and reinstalled 3 times to get it reset but nothing works I have registered twice since I could not log in. Now both account registrations fail. When I try to go to the web page for my account "myblossom.com/account" I am redirected to the SCOTT products web site with no account log in. This whole product and APP for me was a scam..

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: This smart watering controller is not to smart. It difficult to initially set up and even more of a problem keeping the lawn watered properly. It constantly sends me a message that due to weather conditions zone 1 and 5 other zones will not be watered today. The problem is that there is no forecast for rain at my location. Yet when it rains the controller runs all zones. I am thankful for the notice that it will not water because I can at least turn on the water from my phone. Tech support although very friendly is of no help with this issue. I did give it 1 star because the phone app does work

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, easy to configure for smart sprinkling -- ONLY KNOCK is not multi-unit supported on the app
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit, for the price and features for using Alexa and their own app. The reason I bought it again for my other property. Only problem is their app cannot support two different Blossom controllers without setting up separate accounts with different email addresses. I've called their support and raised a ticket for this, but doubt it will go anywhere. So perfect for a single household, but if you have multiple properties this is not the product to use on the same mobile app.
customer_reviews.author: WayneBo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what I need. It does not have all the manual functionality of the old hunter system I replaced. It is missing any unit mounted controls. You must use the app to manually operate it or set your schedules. In my case that has not been an issue at all. You can create very complex scheduling and watering rules compared to older tech. You can also adjust each zones overall watering compared to the baseline. It accounts for weather in your zipcode including increasing and decreasing watering times automatically. I have been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LividSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Not very Smart
customer_reviews.text: does not register a Hawaii address...must use a smart phone to configure..unit kept getting hung up through the Bloosom app so I had to connect to the wi-fi router component of the device to configure and that also kept getting hung up.. if you dont know much about IT it would be very difficult to configure on your own...also the website is lacking any informational support ..once its setup its not that smart just basic options and very little data stored or provided to be "smart"...due to the shortcomings i think you can get a basic watering system to accomplish the same task, this device comes well short of being smart

customer_reviews.title: the app really sucks
customer_reviews.text: so their primary app 'blossom' is horrible, I suggest using their 'gro connect' app from scott. both apps require a constant internet connection to work and so does the device so if internet goes out, no water for you! once you get it all setup, it does work nicely but they really need to add an offline mode. They also seem to have server issues which will also stop your system from not working

After multiple conversations with tech support, was able to get it setup using the groConnect app from Scotts (who apparently bought the company a while ago). I would not recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: It's better than what I had.
customer_reviews.text: The ability to turn it on and off from anywhere is great. Unfortunately it doesn't quite provide the control in selecting the exact day and time of watering. It only allows for 4, 6, 8, 10, or 12 hour intervals. I live in an area where watering times are strictly limited due to a drought and fines can be issued for watering outside of those times. I wish I was able to pick and choose the exact day and time of each watering to ensure avoiding those fines.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Warren

customer_reviews.title: Software with a lot of issues.
customer_reviews.text: Good: Easy to Install Works with Scotts Grow App. (Blossom was bought by scotts corp.) when is working fine he can skip watering during rain. Bad: It has a lot of software issues Smart watering never reports the correct estimated time. just says 3 min and then it waters for 33min Water Sense doesnt work at all. I've contacted Support and they told me to disable it. it was watering 30 mins every 2 hours 1 zone. just randomly In general the hardware is good. it just needs more development in the software to be a good device. don't even try to use it with the blossom app it's way worst.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this. This was a breeze and didnt even need to read instructions. Works great from my iphone I've been showing it off.lol. and the install was pretty easy, just took a pic of the wiring on the old one for reference, and then I plugged these wires into the appropriate slots. Took 10 mins maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: 11 months and yanked both Blossom Controllers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Blossom controllers to replace two analog units a year ago. I was impressed with the tech of launching my sprinklers from my phone. After a year the tech turned out to be glitchy and failure prone as well as a huge pain with two controllers. Blossom does not support two controllers with one app so I had to have two loggins and actually remove the app to switch to another email instance. Also the controller launched my sprinklers out of schedule and sometimes leave a zone on for an hour. Too hard to keep...I removed them both today, 1 month shy of a year. I do NOT recommend this product

customer_reviews.title: Nice but dumb

There are a couple of glaring issues, first the app only supports one controller so you have to log in and out to switch - a big pain. The controllers lose their WiFi connection about every 14 days and will not water - lost a very expensive tree in a pot due to a controller being disconnected. I won’t buy anymore and am looking to replace the three I have with something easier to use and more reliable.

product_meta.title: Blossom 0080-AWICD 7 Zone Wi-Fi Smart Water Controller
product_meta.description: Simplify your life with the power of Smart Watering. No more aimless tinkering with your old irrigation controller. The Blossom Smart Watering Controller automatically programs itself based on real-time local weather data collected from the Internet to create an optimized watering schedule for your yard. This means that on the sunniest, hottest days, Blossom will apply extra water to replenish dry soil. On cooler, less sunny days, Blossom adjusts to irrigate less. If measurable rain is in the weather forecast, Blossom skips watering for that day. The result is an automatically adjusted irrigation plan tailored for your lawn and garden that can be monitored from anywhere at any time from your smartphone or tablet over this Wi-Fi enabled system. Compatible only with locations in the continental United States. Blossom 7 has a known compatibility issue with some newer Comcast / Xfinity XB6 Xfi enabled routers. The specific model numbers included are: -Arris TG3482G (XB6) -Technicolor CGM4140COM (XB6). If you have any of the above routers, please contact us at 1-855-976-5315 or mygro-support@scotts for additional details.
feature_bullets: Uses up-to-the minute satellite based weather data so sprinklers water only when they need to
Enables you to optimize your water usage
Create a watering schedule for your sprinkler system from anywhere by using a smartphone or tablet
Installs in as little as 15 minutes
Covers 7 watering zones The connector for the Pump Start Relay (PSR) can alternatively be set to support an eighth zone.
Replace your outdated controller in minutes
Blossom is for indoor installation only; compatible only with locations in the continental United States

Control your Blossom Smart Watering Controller with your Alexa device. Run all your zones or specify a zone and runtime duration. This skill requires you to have a Blossom account and device already set up.
